data.name: 1953: NATO vs Warsaw Pact
data.detailed_description:
FIND HMUR!


About the Game

What if the Cold War turned hot in 1953?

1953: NATO vs Warsaw Pact is a large-scale, turn-based wargame that simulates a fictional Third World War triggered by Stalinâ€™s death and a breakdown in East-West diplomacy.

Take control of over 30 nations across a detailed hex-based map of Europe, covering more than 40,000 tiles. Whether you're commanding NATO forces or the Warsaw Pact, you'll face a brutal campaign of attrition, diplomacy, and nuclear brinkmanship.

ðŸ§­ Features:

â€“ Massive hex map of Europe with historical geography and borders

â€“ Playable nations include the US, UK, France, USSR, East Germany, Poland, and many more

â€“ 5 tech trees including nuclear weapons, advanced logistics, air and naval upgrades

â€“ Sabotage and coups: Influence neutral countries and destabilize opponents

â€“ Detailed supply mechanics: Weather, fuel, morale, and fog of war all matter

â€“ Hotseat support: Play solo or against another human on the same PC

This is a system-heavy strategy game with a classic interface and long turn processing times. It's made for fans of traditional hex wargames and Cold War history. There's no hand-holding â€” only hard decisions in a brutal alternate timeline.

data.short_description: Cold War turns hot in 1953: massive hex strategy with nukes, supply, and sabotage.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows Vista
  • Processor: 1.4
  • Memory: 2048 MB RAM
  • Graphics: 512 MB
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Storage: 800 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: W8
  • Processor: 1.8 Dual Core
  • Memory: 4096 MB RAM
  • Graphics: 2048
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Storage: 1200 MB available space
